bib_record.title: Measurement of the doubly-polarized 3He(gamma,n)pp reaction at 16.5MeV and its implications for the GDH sum rule

free_txt: Vilnius University, Vilnius
High Intensity gamma Source HIGS -
Storage Ring (SR) Free-Electron-Laser (FEL)
Sixteen liquid BC-501A scintillation detectors
beam direction on both sides are arranged at 1 m
distance from the centre of the target, and two
liquid BC-501 scintillation detectors at 90 degrees
w.r.t the beam direction on both sides of the target
sample D20 for photon flux monitoring at the end of
the beam line.
Statistical uncertainty

High Intensity gamma Source HIGS -
Storage Ring (SR) Free-Electron-Laser (FEL)
The laser Compton scattering photon
beam developed at HIGS facility. The facility
provided nearly monoenergetic, ~100% circularly
polarized gamma-ray beams. The photon beam was
collimated using a 12 mm diameter collimator
resulting in beam energy spreads (dE/E) of ~

free_txt: The 3He target cell was a one-piece glassware made of
Pyrex glass consisting of two chambers: a spherical
pumping chamber 8.1 cm in diameter and a 39.3-cm-long
and 2.9-cm-diameter cylindrical target chamber having
entrance and exit windows 250 um thick. The two
chambers were connected through a 9.1-cm-long
transfer tube which was 7.8 mm in diameter. The
filling density of 3He was 6.48 +- 0.1 amagat(amg).In
addition to the 3He gas, about 0.1 amg of N2 gas was
in the target as a buffer gas. 1 amagat is the number
density of an ideal gas at 0 deg C and 1 atmosphere:
1 amg = 2.6894E+19 atoms/cm3.
Data presented in fig.1 of the reference
sent by author (G.L.)
